channel.title: Textures inside Hammer Editor won't load.
channel.description:
[align=center]So something weird happens with my Hammer Editor. Some textures won't render inside the 3D view when i'm making maps.[/size] In-game they all render normally[/size]. It's quite weird and sometimes annoying, because I can't see like if the texture is aligned correctly, if there is something wrong with it, etc.
First and second screenshots: The selected brushes are supposed to be Nodraw on the outside (they are with nodraw) but do not render. [img]https://i.imgur.com/Qj0VSDn.jpg[/img] [img]https://i.imgur.com/yvGa4El.jpg[/img]
Third screenshot: The selected brushes are using the Skybox texture (tools/toolsskybox) but again, do not render. [img]https://i.imgur.com/HYYtkld.jpg[/img]
Fourth screenshot: These are supposed to be unbreakable glass (this seems to happen with every glass texture) [img]https://i.imgur.com/IkGYbaU.jpg[/img]
Last screenshot: These use a wood plank texture: [img]https://i.imgur.com/oMqZCVV.jpg[/img]
Note: They DO render normally in-game.[/size]
PS: How can I add custom textures in the game? I've tried to add one for the target on the range but they always appear as missing textures. I've followed many tutorials but they seem not to work every time I try.[/size] [/size][/align]

I think I found a workaround…? I am not sure if this is the same bug, but I recall having a similar problem in the past. Click on the “camera” button in the top left corner of the 3D view, and click “3D Textured”. You may notice the lighting may get slightly brighter, but you can easily get used to it. The texture glitches should now be fixed.

I don’t have years of experience with Hammer, so this may not be the best workaround. It’s worked for me so far.

item.dc:creator: FRAG
item.description:
Was going to make a new thread but seen as this one is the issue I’m having, I’ll post here instead.

All brushes that have Nodraw applied to a face cease to render at all in hammer.

1920×1051

I’ve had this issue since your CSM update and I’ll list off the thing’s I’ve done to try and sort out this issue I’m having

  • Tried pointing my GTX 960 to hammer (was done already as onboard is disabled to avoid it taking control, re-enabled it to double confirm)
  • Checked game files - 100% fine
  • Checked hammer files - 100% fine
  • Removed & unsubbed to workshop mods
  • Uninstalled Black Mesa & cloud saves
  • Tried other versions of hammer on duplicated Black Mesa maps (to isolate them and not assign changes from other versions) with Black Mesa configs - still same issue.
  • Beat head against keyboard, still no dice and a broken AltGr key

Happy to hear what you think about this because I don’t really know what else I can do now, much love <3

item.title: Textures inside Hammer Editor won't load.
item.dc:creator: Polar-Dog
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

Your Hammer is probably loading below DX9/Shader Model 2.0, which we stripped out support for in the last update, for optimisation.

In your graphics card control panel, ensure that Hammer is set to use your graphics card, and not integrated graphics. This will resolve the issue for sure.

The problem is: I currently use a Laptop, so I do not think it HAS a graphics card. (It’s pretty damn old)
I do know it uses an integrated graphics setting, but again, I’m not aware if it has a graphics card, neither where to find the config panel

item.dc:creator: Polar-Dog
item.description:
LordDz:

How to add custom textures:

Use VTFEdit, import the texture of your choice, save it as .vtf, in a folder you want your textures to be in the blackmesa materials folder.
Simple, put them in a folder called polardog at your desktop.
in VTFEdit go to Tools -> Generate .vmt

Copy the polardog folder into your bms materials folder.
If you open the .vmt in Notepad++ you can see the path it has set for the texture.

Reopen hammer editor to get the new textures.
Repopen black mesa to get it to use the new textures.
